info.name: Quote API
info.description:
This collection represents 4 different interfaces that can be used to verify class code availability (Risk Appetite), determine what coverages may be offered (Coverages), create and update a Quote (Quote) and determine what forms are available for that Quote (Forms List).

A Quote may start as a simple Quick Quote and then advance into a Full Quote by calling the Quote API again as many times as needed.  Any Quote request may update Limits, add or removing Class Codes,  add or remove Forms, Coverages, and Additional Insureds or even adjust Subjectivities, Taxes and Fees.  Requests may combine these changes into a single call, or make a unique request for each change that is desired.

The completed Quote may be Bound by utilizing the ResumeLink to link the end-user directly into the Digital Workbench to finalize the new Quote.

As of Q2 2020 the Quote API supports General Liability, with Property scheduled to be added later in the year.

item.name: Risk Appetite

exec: pm.test("Expect a Success status returned", function () {
pm.test("Expect State to be Arizona", function () {
pm.test("Expect Line of Business to be Comprehensive General Liability ", function () {
pm.test("Expect Results to contain State, LOB", function () {

request.description:
Request the Limits and Classcodes that are acceptable within a specific State. 

For each class a description, your authority to write the class, Company specific notes and ISO notes are returned. 

Notes fields are returned in HTML format and are appropriate to embed directly into a web application to retain formatting such as tables and fonts.

response.name: Appetite - Single State

Risks that hire subcontractors should be classified and rated in accordance with an appropriate construction contracting classification.\nCoverage does not apply to professional architectural, engineering or surveying activities done by or for the named insured. ", "IsoNotes": "\nThis classification applies to risks engaged in the manufacturing of telecommunication products of all kinds including any telecommunication devices, equipment, accessories, apparatus and related parts.\nThis classification includes installation, service or repair of telecommunication products sold to others by the insured. Leasing of such equipment either on a long term or short term basis is also included.", "companyNotes": "", "isoNotes": "" }, { "ClassCode": "18575", "Description": "Telecommunications Equipment Providers", "Authority": "A/A", "CompanyNotes": "\nELPS:\nELP - Prem Ops - .25\nELP - Products - .80\n", "IsoNotes": "\nThis classification applies to risks that sell, service, repair or lease telecommunication devices, apparatus and equipment of all kinds. It also applies to risks that provide consulting services for others in reference to their specific needs on telecommunication equipment.\nCoverage for liability because of errors or omissions arising out of the insured's evaluation, consultation or advice provided to others is excluded. Use Exclusion - Telecommunication Equipment Or Service Providers Errors And Omissions Endorsement CG 22 91.", "companyNotes": "", "isoNotes": "" }, { "ClassCode": "99600", "Description": "Telecommunications Service Providers", "Authority": "A/A", "CompanyNotes": "\nRequired Forms:\nCG 2138, Personal/Advertising Injury Exclusion;\nCG 2291, Errors and Omissions Exclusion;\n", "IsoNotes": "\nThis classification applies to risks operating as a carrier or the supporter of telecommunication messages or information to others. The risk may be referred to as a telecommunication service vendor, aggregator, reseller, rebiller, etc.\nOperations include transmitting of customers' local or long-distance calls through conventional, cable or optical wire or wireless communications, and paging, Faxing, answering or ID (identifying caller's name or number) services.\nOperations also include the installation of any equipment on customers' premises which is essential for the insured to transmit local or long-distance calls for such customers and necessary wire connections.\nThis classification applies to such risks whether or not the insured bills its customers directly or the billing is made by means of another telecommunication carrier.\nCoverage for liability because of errors or omissions arising out of the insured's evaluation, consultation or advice provided to others is excluded. Use Exclusion - Telecommunication Equipment Or Service Providers Errors And Omissions Endorsement CG 22 91.\nThis classification includes the existence of relay stations, including towers or disc antennae or cell sites that are owned and used by the insured.\nFor premium computation purposes, include the payroll of outside salespersons, collectors, messengers and clerical.\nThe following shall be separately classified and rated:\n- Telecommunication line construction (conventional, cable, or optical wire) or construction of relay stations, including towers or disc antennae or cell sites of all kinds for wireless telecommunication services.\n- Towers that are leased solely to others for telecommunication services.", "companyNotes": "", "isoNotes": "" }, { "ClassCode": "99614", "Description": "Telegraph Companies", "Authority": "A/A", "CompanyNotes": "", "IsoNotes": "\nTelephone and telegraph line construction shall be separately classified and rated.\nFor premium computation purposes, include the payroll of outside salespersons, collectors, messengers and clerical.", "companyNotes": "", "isoNotes": "" }, { "ClassCode": "99613", "Description": "Telephone, Telegraph or Cable Television Line Construction", "Authority": "A/A", "CompanyNotes": "\nSupplemental application required\nSubmit:\n1. item.description:
The Risk Appetite API is designed to provide a list of all available risks for the provided state, LOB and User. Optionally the API can be used to retrieve a verbose list including all states which can be used to pre-populate a General Agent’s internal application without requiring an API call to be submitted to retrieve acceptable limit and class information for each new quote.

The verbose example may return a very large response and may take 45 - 90 seconds to complete.  It is not intended for real-time transactions.

item.description: The Forms List API provides a list of forms which are available for a specific Quote and User along with additional information needed to populate the form properly.  This API can be used to validate the existing forms schedule associated with a quote or to determine which forms may require additional data to be populated before the quote may be bound.  Form selection and removal should be completed using the Quote API.

item.name: Quote

To retrieve the current view of an existing quote, provide the quotenumber and set "InquireOnly" to "Yes"

No other information will be processed from the request.  If additional fields are provided they will be ignored.

1. Errors and Omissions Coverage (ASIC-GL-0024) is included at limits equal to the General Liability limit (If ASIC-GL-0024 is NOT selected, then Exclusion- Designated Professional Services (CG 21 16) is required). \r
2. Sexual and/or Physical Abuse (ASIC-GL-0077) included at $100,000/$300,000 limits. Increased limits of $300,000/$300,000 available for a $300 flat charge (If ASIC-GL-0077 is NOT selected, then Sexual and/or Physical Abuse Exclusion (ASIC-GL-0074) is required).", "ISOTXT": "
This classification applies to risks which provide supervision, medical care and social activities for senior citizens or other adults who live at home but cannot be left alone, or prefer to be with others, during the day. Operations may include administering of medication, health monitoring and food service.
This type of risk usually employs full-time nurses or home health professionals in addition to non-professional staff.
Coverage does not apply to injury or damage arising out of medical professional service provided by or on behalf of the insured to anyone in the care of any insured.
Coverage does not apply to medical payments to any person in the care of the insured.
Use Exclusion - Adult Day Care Centers Endorsement CG 22 87.

item.name: Example 6 - Changing the ClassCode and Related Fields

exec: pm.test("Expect a Quote No for all the results", function () {
pm.test("Expect a Success status returned", function () {

request.description:
The ClassCode object can be modified to adjust the ClassCode itself, or other information such as Exposure, Location address or adjusting premium.

The ClassCode object is referenced by providing the existing ClassNumber in a new request that provides the updated information

The example updates an existing ClassLocation to change the Classcode from 60010 to 91111, fill-in an incomplete address and override the calculated premium.

The example starts with the following quote information:

   "ClassLocation":[
      {
         "ApplyMod":"No",
         "OverridePremium":"No",
         "ClassNumber":1,
         "ClassCode":"60010",
         "Addr1":"",
         "City":"",
         "State":"NY",
         "Zip":"12404",
         "Exposure":"4000000",
         "ApplyModAmt":0,
         "Description":"Apartment Bldgs.",
         "CalcPremium":"627719040",
         "IfAny":"Yes",
         "Included":"No",
         "OverridePremiumAmt":0,
         "CooperativeHousing":0,
         "CompanyNotesHTML":"<REMOVED>",
         "ISOTXT":"<REMOVED>",
         "Authority":"A/A",
         "PremiumBasis":"Number of Units",
         "StateSpecificHTML":"<REMOVED>",
         "TotalPremium":"627719040",
         "MinimumPremium":0    
}]

request.description:
Optional Coverages may be added by creating a new object in CGL.OptionalCoverages.  Optional Coverages are referenced by their FormNumber, adding a new object with a unique FormNumber will add that OC to a Quote.

Optional Coverages may be removed from an existing Quote by referencing the FormNumber and updating the Selected Field to “No”.
 
 This example uses a quote starting with the following:

request.description:
Additional Insureds may be added by creating a new object in CGL.AdditionalInsureds.  Additional Insureds are referenced by their FormNumber and Title, adding a new object with a unique FormNumber and Title will add that AI to a Quote.

Additional Insureds may be removed from an existing Quote by referencing the FormNumber and Title and updating the Selected Field to “No”.

response.name: Quote - Example 8 - Adding or Removing an Additional Insured

The Taxes, Fees, and Commissions section of the Digital Workbench is represented within the Quote API in CGL.TaxFeeComm. Standard Taxes and Fees can be entered as well as custom fees.  

The following example adjusts the Inspection Fee and adds a new custom Stamp Fee.

request.description:
The Quote API is designed to be tolerant of invalid combinations of limits, coverages, or forms being submitted.  In most cases this will not result in an error returned from the API but will instead result in the Quote API attempting to adjust the quote to the next-best combination of values based on what was requested.  In these cases the resulting quote may contain a slightly different limit or coverage amount, or a slightly modified forms schedule.  

When modifications are made to the quote, a summary of the adjustments that were made will be presented within the Notices array at the top of the response.  The requesting system or user is responsible for reviewing the response to verify that the desired values are appropriate for the quote being requested. 

 
The following example submits a Quick Quote / Indication request to the Quote API with a basic amount of information: 
•	Requests a CGL Quote with Limits of $400k Each Occurrence and $2M Aggregate.  This is an invalid combination
•	The request does not provide a city and state for the ClassLocation but it does provide a valid ZipCode.  
•	There is no Effective Date or Expiration Date provided
•	There are no other limits provided

response.name: Example 11 - Submitting Invalid Choices

request.description: When adding an AdditionalInsured, the form number is used to identify the desired form. In some situations the same form number may have two different titles representing different AIs.  In these situations, thecombination of “Form Number” and “Form title” is used to identify the correct form.

request.description: In optional Coverage section, the form number is used to identify a form when adding or removing it from a quote. In a small number of cases such as Hired / Non-Owned Auto the same form number may represent separate coverages.  In these cases, the Form Title is used to differentiate the two Coverages. In the example shown, if the Form Title is skipped then the Quote API will select “Hired Auto”

request.description:
The AgentReferenceID is an optional unique identifier for a quote.  The field may be used to pass in an index from an Agent rater or other internal system to make it easier to retrieve in the future.   

If an AgentReferenceID is provided that has never been used, the Digital Workbench will create a new quote based on the rest of the request, and will store the AgentReferenceID with the Quote for future use.

If you wish to use the AgentReferenceID, it must be added during the initial creation of an Indication/Quote. An AgentReferenceID cannot be added to an existing quote.

item.description:
The Quote API is designed to create, update and view a quote within the Ategrity Digital Workbench.  The interface can accept almost any data that can be added to a quote through the Digital Workbench and is designed to be very tolerant to requests that may be missing data or have invalid data.  

 

The goal of the Quote API is to provide a valid quote even if portions of the request may be missing or may contain invalid data.  If limited data is provided in the request, the Quote API will use default values for any fields that may be missing.  If invalid values are requested, the Quote API will attempt to adjust the invalid values to the next acceptable value so that a valid quote can be returned without re-submitting the request. To ensure the calling system can represent the quote properly, it is important to review the “Notice” section of the API response.  The Notice section will provide a list of all values that were found invalid or any forms that may have been in conflict.  This section should be reviewed to ensure that the consuming system reflects the quote properly.  Any items listed within the notice section should be read from the response and updated within the requesting system.
